head.supplied: 13/7/81. ¶ Memo ¶ ¶ The Chief Secretary will be glad if the Government Botanist can furnish to this office copies of any treatises reports &c that it may be in his power conveniently to supply in ref...

div.p: No. 2521, p. 1105, unit 57, VPRS 1187/P, outward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office of Victoria

p.style: margin-top: 0in; margin-bottom: 0in; font-size: 12pt; font-family: Geneva; text-align: end;
margin-top: 0in; margin-bottom: 0in; text-align: start; font-size: 12pt; font-family: Geneva;
margin-top: 0in; margin-bottom: 0in; text-align: start; font-size: 12pt; font-family: Geneva;

div.p:
The Chief Secretary will be glad if the Government Botanist can furnish to this office copies of any treatises reports &c that it may be in his power conveniently to supply in reference to the disease caused by the Phylloxera Vastatrix for the information of the Government.
See M to J. Grant, 16 July 1881, which, however, is a register entry only, recording receipt of M's response; the response itself has not been found. Unless it's 81-06-16! The register entry indicates that M enclosed unidentified publications with his response.

p.style: margin-top: 0in; margin-bottom: 0in; text-align: start; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in; font-family: Geneva;
margin-top: 0in; margin-bottom: 0in; text-align: start; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in; font-family: Geneva;
margin-top: 0in; margin-bottom: 0in; text-align: start; font-size: 12pt; font-family: Geneva;

div.p:
I should be glad to see the Papers received from the Colonial Office on the subject which were provided to you with the Under Secretary's letter of 9th May.
Letter not found.
